---- Create a user with name 'employee' using mysql command prompt

CREATE USER 'employee' IDENTIFIED BY 'employee';

---- Conntect to the user using command prompt

mysql -u employee -p
employee
	
---- Create database

CREATE DATABASE  IF NOT EXISTS EMPLOYEE_DATABASE;

USE EMPLOYEE_DATABASE;

---- Create tables

DROP TABLE IF EXISTS EMPLOYEE;
DROP TABLE IF EXISTS USER;

-- It is better to use auto generated tables by spring jpa 
CREATE TABLE EMPLOYEE(
   ID BIGINT(20) NOT NULL,
   FIRST_NAME VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
   MIDDL_ENAME VARCHAR(100) NULL,
   LAST_NAME VARCHAR(100) NULL,
   SALARY BIGINT(20),
   ROLE VARCHAR(100),
   EMAIL VARCHAR(100),
   DOB TIMESTAMP,
   GENDER VARCHAR(100),
   MOBILE_NUMBER VARCHAR(100),
   MARITALSTATUS VARCHAR(100) DEFAULT NULL,
   ADDRESS VARCHAR(300),
   CREATED_BY VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
   CREATED_DATE TIMESTAMP NOT NULL DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
   MODIFIED_BY VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
   MODIFIED_DATE TIMESTAMP NOT NULL DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
   PRIMARY KEY ( ID )
);


CREATE TABLE USER(
   ID BIGINT(20) NOT NULL,
   USER_ID VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
   PASSWORD VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
   NAME VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
   EMAIL VARCHAR(100),
   MOBILE_NUMBER VARCHAR(100),
   ACCESS_TYPES VARCHAR(100),
   PRIMARY KEY ( ID )
);
